title: Redesign Progress Comparison slot headers (Option banner + inline date/variance + Change button)

requirements.text: Update the Progress Comparison slot header UI (the component used for each of the three compare slots) so the first element is a full-width top banner that reads “Option 1”, “Option 2”, or “Option 3” (matching the slot number), with each option having a harmonious but distinct outline color; keep the design aligned with the existing forced dark theme and design tokens.

quotes: The option number (1,2,3) should be first with words e.g. Option 1, Option 2, Option 3, it must be a banner at the top of the header each with a unique outline colour

acceptanceCriteria: Each compare slot header displays a full-width banner at the top that says exactly “Option 1”, “Option 2”, or “Option 3”.
The banner uses an outline (not fill) and Option 1/2/3 each has a distinct, visually harmonious outline color.
The updated banner styling does not break readability/contrast in the app’s forced dark theme.

requirements.text: Redesign the second line of each compare slot header to show the selected date and an auto-calculated day-variance indicator inline next to the date; the day-variance indicator must be icon-first with a clock icon and presented primarily as an icon/badge (option b), with the variance value revealed via tooltip or secondary text styling rather than being the primary large label.

quotes: next line should be the date, next to it should be the auto calc value in a different colour or maybe as an icon with a background and also include a clock icon infront of it.

acceptanceCriteria: The second line shows the formatted selected date and a compact clock-icon variance indicator inline next to it.
The variance indicator is styled as a badge/pill with its own background or contrasting styling consistent with existing tokens.
The variance value is not presented as the primary large text; it is revealed via a tooltip or clearly secondary text styling.

requirements.text: Place the “Change” button on the same row as the date + variance indicator within each compare slot header, aligned inline (not on a separate line).

quotes: Inline then should be the Change Button

acceptanceCriteria: The “Change” button is on the same row as the date and variance indicator in each slot header.
The layout remains stable and readable across common viewport sizes (no overlapping; sensible wrapping if needed).

constraints: Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn components must be composed, not edited).
Do not modify files in frontend.immutablePaths as defined by SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: No changes to comparison slot selection logic or how variance is computed; only update the header presentation.
